levels.instruction: Keep extremely close to the original template. Only make essential copy adjustments for accuracy. Do not change any layout or visual elements
levels.description: Conservative: Minimal changes to the template

levels.instruction: Stay very close to the original template but allow for improvements in flow and readability. You can make adjustments to improve clarity or engagement, but maintain the overall structure and key messages. Keep the same tone and style, with only slight variations where it enhances the message & layout.

Use the template as a strong foundation but feel free to enhance it. You can rephrase sections to improve engagement while keeping the core message and structure. Maintain the general flow but add your own touch to make it more compelling. The key messages should remain the same but can be expressed in fresh ways. you should still use the ain image of the template.
levels.description: Balanced: Moderate creativity while respecting template

levels.instruction: Use the template as inspiration but feel free to be creative. You can significantly rephrase content, adjust the structure, and enhance the messaging while keeping the core purpose. Feel free to add new elements or sections if they enhance the message. The tone can be adjusted to better suit the context while maintaining professionalism.

Use the template only as a reference for the core message and objective. You have full creative freedom to reimagine the email while maintaining its purpose. Feel free to completely restructure, rephrase, and enhance the content. You can experiment with different approaches, tones, and structures as long as they align with professional communication standards and the company's core message.
